article.headline: DePaul 72, Loyola Chi 50
article.story: TOWSON, Md. (AP) -- Jimmy Boykin had 27 points and Kelvin Green had 12 points and 9 rebounds off the bench to lead Coppin State to an 82-65 win over Loyola on Saturday. The Eagles (2-3) used tight pressure defense and a 12-0 run to begin the second half on their way to winning the consolation game of the four-team Battle of Baltimore. Charlie Bell led the Greyhounds (0-2) with 22 points. Bernard Allen added 14 points and 5 rebounds off the bench. Coppin State's second half run gave them a 50-35 lead, the first double-digit lead of the game for either team. Boykin and Nicholas King each had 5 points during the game-clinching run. The Eagles held a 38-35 halftime lead on the strength of a 12-2 run to end a back and forth first half that included six lead changes and two ties. Boykin had 5 points for Coppin during the big run at the end of the half. Loyola led by 7 points on three occasions in the half, but never led again after the Eagles' first-half run.
